Message.Title: Market Analysis
Message.Msg: Window Dressing week. Dow 13500 must hold by the close. October will be worse month of the year.

Message.Title: Election's Impact on Stocks
Message.Msg: Ronmey's 47% comment could be his Waterloo which would be devastating for stocks short term

Message.Title: Bernanke
Message.Msg: "There is no housing bubble" "I will not monetize the debt" Biggest liar to ever run the Fed Has killed more retirees than Hitler killed Jews.

The market got ahead of itself, and will correct back to technical levels. I see the Nasdaq trading down to its 50 DMA which is 3100. Another 50 points to the downside before the next leg up. The stock market has risen in the 4th quarter 82% of the time in a presidential election year since WWII. The average increase is 10%. That means the Nasdaq may end the year around 3400?
Playing that card means you automatically lose any argument you had, thought you knew better, you would make a 'good' Liberal. Now play the race card, make us all laugh...... HAR!!!!
Notiice how the buyers jumped in when the Dow reached 13500 area this morning? And people think the market isn't manipulated. Give me a break !
Iran crsis will send stocks tumbling in Oct. There is no way Bibi will not act.
Crisis in the Middle East? I have been hearing that headline for 50 years...
don't forget that 18% of the time, the market sank in the 4th quarter. This could be a time when it won't rise.

Topic.Title: Obama: How Much Socialism is "just right" in a society

Message.Msg: ... don't look beyond the immediate impact of government policy on themselves personally. The most important thing to understand is that a country like Singapore maintains low taxes, is a magnet for risk capital, and is growing and flourishing economically like the U.S. did 100 years ago with the same kinds of fiscal policies. Europe, on the other hand, has a bloated entitlement system, high taxes, big debt, and is failing economically. In every single respect that you can measure, Barak Obama is following the European model... ... and the U.S. is on a fast track toward emulating the same results that Europe is experiencing. In 3 years, the U.S. debt-to-GDP ratio will exceed Greece's given Obama's present course... by the end of a 2nd, Obama term, we will be as bankrupt as Greece is. S
